Overview: This course is a graduate-level course in the design and analysis of algorithms. We study techniques for the design of algorithms (such as dynamic programming) and algorithms for fundamental problems (such as fast Fourier transform FFT). In addition, we study computational intractability, specifically, the theory of NP-completeness. The main topics covered in the course include: dynamic programming; divide and conquer, including FFT; randomized algorithms, including RSA cryptosystem;Â  graph algorithms; max-flow algorithms; linear programming; and NP-completeness.

Suggested Background Knowledge: CS 8001 OLP is a one credit-hour seminar designed to fulfill prerequisites to succeed in CS 6515. More information is available on theCS 8001 Seminars page.
